subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Testing Code That Has System.exit(n);

messageBody:
Michael Feathers wrote:

> But, that aside, I do think that people ought to be able to write tests
> for code that exits.

I agree. I've added this to the list of topics to talk about at the
panel at SDBP next week. :-)

> And, I think that the should be able to do it
> without having to think about writing security managers. They are a
> higher level of voodoo than interfaces.

Perhaps, but I think it's reasonable to expect some voodoo here. While
this application appears to be vastly overusing exit, there are
legitimate reasons to exit, and I think the original developer has a
reasonable expectation that code will exit when asked. Failing to do so
could easily become a serious security hole.
